statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Chaz Williams had the first double-double of his career with 20 points and 10 assists to lead Massachusetts over Northeastern 83-67 on Monday night.
article.headline: Chaz Williams powers UMass rout of Northeastern
article.linkText: Williams powers UMass rout of Northeastern
article.story: AMHERST, Mass. -- Chaz Williams had the first double-double of his career with 20 points and 10 assists to lead Massachusetts over Northeastern 83-67 on Monday night. The sophomore transfer from Hofstra, who had career highs in both categories, scored 15 of his points as the Minutemen (2-0) outscored the Huskies 43-39 in the second half. The Huskies (1-1) brought it within six, 57-51, with 10:28 to go on Joel Smith's 3-pointer. But Williams took over, dishing to Freddie Riley for a layup on the break, and then scoring back-to-back layups of his own to make it 65-61 with 7:38 remaining. The Minutemen then built their lead to as many as 17, 55-38, with 13:38 to play. Terrell Vinson added 14 points and Sampson Carter 12 for UMass, which outscored the Huskies 28-6 on the fast break. Jonathan Lee and Joel Smith scored 15 points each for Northeastern.
